info.title: Event Reporting API
info.description:
Use this API to report cancellation and delay events, as well as other SLA
breaches, directly to Ruter, along with a flag indicating whether you as an operator consider that
the event was outside your control, and that you should be exempt from being fined for
incurred/reported SLA breach(es).

post.description: Report a cancellation or delay event.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
OAuth2 access token as Bearer token.

**NOTE:** Separate documentation will be provided on how to obtain client credentials and use these
to request access tokens.

201.description:
The traffic event was registered.

The response contains a single traffic event for the given journey if the registration provided a
`journeyRef`. If the registration provided a `lineRef` and a time interval, the response contains
one traffic event for each journey that took place on the given line in the given time period.

400.description: One or more invalid input parameters (e.g., invalid `category`)

403.description: Invalid access token or insufficient access for operation

post.description:
Report an SLA breach directly to Ruter, along with a flag indicating whether you as
an operator consider that the breach was outside your control, and that you should be exempt from
being fined for the breach.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
OAuth2 access token as Bearer token.

**NOTE:** Separate documentation will be provided on how to obtain client credentials and use these
to request access tokens.

400.description: One or more invalid input parameters (e.g., invalid `category`)

403.description: Invalid access token or insufficient access for operation

eventNumber.description: The traffic event number. Format: <registration-ID>-<sequence number>

registrationId.description: The ID of the traffic event registration that was submitted for this traffic event.

status.description: The status of the traffic event.

trafficCaseNumber.description:
The traffic case number of the Ruterlogg traffic case that was created from the
traffic event registration submitted for this traffic event.

category.description: The main category of the traffic event.

subcategory.description: The subcategory of the traffic event.

reasonCategory.description:
The reason category of the traffic event. Inferred from `category`, `subcategory` and
`reason`.

reasonSubcategory.description:
The reason subcategory of the traffic event. Inferred from `category`, `subcategory`
and `reason`.

reason.description: The reason for the traffic event.

reasonDescription.description: If needed, a further detailing of the reason for the traffic event.

datedJourneyRef.description: A reference to the dated journey that is affected by this traffic event.

vehicleInternalNumber.description:
The SIS internal number of the vehicle assigned to the journey and affected by this
event, if any.

lineRef.description: A reference to the line that the journey is serving.

vehicleTaskId.description: The ID of the vehicle task that the journey was part of.

startDateTime.description: An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the traffic event started.

endDateTime.description: An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the traffic event ended.

quayRefs.description:
If `category` is `CANCELLATION`: A list of NSR quay references to the quays
affected by the cancellation. `null` otherwise.

delayMinutes.description:
If `category` is `DELAY`: The number of minutes that the journey is delayed. `null`
otherwise.

isOperatorExempt.description:
A flag indicating whether you as an operator should be exempt from being fined for
any SLA breach(es) incurred as a consequence of this traffic event.

registeredBy.description: Your operator's client identifier, automatically inferred from your API credentials.

registeredAt.description: The date and time that the traffic event was registered, in ISO UTC format.

category.description: The main category of the traffic event.

subcategory.description:
The subcategory of the traffic event.

Permitted values if `category` is `CANCELLATION`:
- `FULL`
- `PARTIAL`

Permitted values if `category` is `DELAY`:
- `FROM_START`
- `IN_TRANSIT`

reason.description:
The reason for the traffic event. If set to `OTHER_OBSTRUCTION` or
`OTHER_TECHNICAL_PROBLEM`, a description must be provided in the `reasonDescription` field.

reasonDescription.description:
Required if `reason` is set to `OTHER_OBSTRUCTION` or `OTHER_TECHNICAL_PROBLEM`,
optional otherwise. A further detailing of the reason for the traffic event, and if relevant, an
explanation for why you as an operator should be exempt from being fined for any SLA breach(es)
incurred as a consequence of this traffic event (see `isOperatorExempt`).

startDateTime.description:
Required if `datedJourneyRef` is `null`, optional otherwise. An ISO UTC date string
representing the date and time that the traffic event started. If `null`, the start time of the
journey represented by `datedJourneyRef` is used instead.

endDateTime.description:
Required if `datedJourneyRef` is `null`, optional otherwise. An ISO UTC date string
representing the date and time that the traffic event ended. If `null`, the end time of the journey
represented by `datedJourneyRef`, plus `delayMinutes` if given, is used instead.

datedJourneyRef.description:
Required if `lineRef` is `null`. A reference to the planned journey that is affected
by this traffic event, if only a single journey is affected.

Format should be one of:
- `<dated journey ID from plan data>`
- `<vehicle task ID>-<journey start date time in ISO offset format>`

vehicleInternalNumber.description:
Required if `datedJourneyRef` is set and a vehicle has been assigned to the journey.
The SIS internal number of the assigned vehicle that is affected by this traffic event, including
prefixed garage number.

lineRef.description:
Required if `datedJourneyRef` is `null`, ignored otherwise. A reference to the
affected line when multiple journeys are affected by this traffic event.

stopPlaceOrQuayRefs.description:
Required if `category` is `CANCELLATION` and `subcategory` is `PARTIAL`,
ignored otherwise. A list of NSR stop place or quay references to the stop places or quays that are
affected by the partial cancellation.

delayMinutes.description:
Required if `category` is `DELAY`, ignored otherwise. The number of minutes that the
journey is delayed.

isOperatorExempt.description:
A flag indicating whether you as an operator consider that the event was outside your
control, and that you should be exempt from being fined for any SLA breach(es) incurred as a
consequence of the traffic event. If needed, an exemption reason can be provided in the
`reasonDescription` field.

breachNumber.description: The SLA breach number. Must be `null` on registration.

reason.description: The reason for the SLA breach.

reasonDescription.description:
Optional. A further detailing of the reason for the SLA breach, and if relevant, an
explanation for why you as an operator should be exempt from being fined for this breach (see
`isOperatorExempt`).

datedJourneyRef.description:
Required if both `vehicleTaskId` and `contractRef` are `null`, takes precedence
over both otherwise. A reference to the planned journey that is affected by this SLA breach.

Format should be one of:
- `<dated journey ID from plan data>`
- `<vehicle task ID>-<journey start date time in ISO offset format>`

vehicleTaskId.description:
Required if both `datedJourneyRef` and `contractRef` are `null`, takes precedence
over `contractRef` otherwise. The ID of the vehicle task that is affected by this SLA breach.

vehicleInternalNumber.description:
Required if `datedJourneyRef` or `vehicleTaskId` is set and a vehicle has been
assigned to the journey or vehicle task. The SIS internal number of the assigned vehicle that is
affected by this SLA breach, including prefixed garage number.

contractRef.description:
Required if both `datedJourneyRef` and `vehicleTaskId` are `null`, ignored otherwise.
A reference to the contract that governs the SLA that was breached.

startDateTime.description:
Required if `contractRef` is set and both `datedJourneyRef` and `vehicleTaskId` are
`null`, ignored otherwise. An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the SLA breach
started. If not set, breach duration is inferred from referenced journey or vehicle task, in that
order.

endDateTime.description:
Required if `contractRef` is set and both `datedJourneyRef` and `vehicleTaskId` are
`null`, ignored otherwise. An ISO UTC date string representing the date and time that the SLA breach
ended. If not set, breach duration is inferred from referenced journey or vehicle task, in that
order.

isOperatorExempt.description:
A flag flag indicating whether you as an operator consider that the breach was
outside your control, and that you should be exempt from being fined for the breach. If needed, an
exemption reason can be provided in the `reasonDescription` field.

registeredBy.description:
Your operator's client identifier, automatically inferred from your API credentials.
Must be `null` on registration.

registeredAt.description:
The date and time that the SLA breach was registered, in ISO UTC format.
Automatically set on registration. Must be `null` on registration.
